RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Claiming Purse 18100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, if for $22,500, allowed 2 lbs. Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed in advisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile Seventy Yards.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CITY OF GOD bobbled at the start, tracked the early leader two deep and finished well to edge clear under strong handling. HANFORD stalked the top pair down the backstretch, moved up from the outside of foes, raced four to five wide around the far turn and finished second best. SILK PRINCE showed good early speed along the inside and weakened in the drive. UPTOWNJACOB BROWN was void of early speed and trailed.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 93. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28900. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-win ners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 26 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022.(If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile Seventy Yards.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WILL E SUTTON settled off the early pace, made an advance into the far turn, made a four wide bid near the quarter pole and finished well to draw clear under strong handling. TRENDING UP dropped back off the early going, swung six wide into the upper stretch and finished willingly to the wire. IRISH HONOR coaxed along early into the first turn, raced from the far outside in the stretch and moved up to improve position. SUPREMACY showed good early foot to set the early pace and gave way in the drive. ROBBY'S RANSOM stalked the pace four deep from the outside of foes and faded in the drive. WE DONT NEED ROADS tracked the early pace between rivals and faded in the drive. PURPLE SHIRT was slow early and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Supremacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: good early speed, set pace, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Irish Honor
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed along early, outside bid, moved up

ENTRY.NAME: We Dont Need Roads
ENTRY.OWNER: Parthemore Jeffrey W and Nicolby Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Trending Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, swung 6wd upper stretch, willlingly

ENTRY.NAME: Robby's Ransom
ENTRY.OWNER: Fountain Springs Stable and DeSales 85 LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 5F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 15400. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 26 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 26 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, if for $6,000, allowed 2 lbs. ( Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main tra ck at Five Furlongs.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BRIT'S CANDYMAN vied three deep from the outside of rivals and kicked on to be well clear under strong handling. LUCKYTOBEINAMERICA was bumped, shuffled back at the start, raced off the early pace, moved up near the rail in the stretch and improved position. EMPIRE'S SCORE was off slowly, raced three deep past the five sixteenths pole, angled out to race from the far outside in the stretch and gained ground late. STANHOPE was bumped soundly at the start, vied inside and weakened in th drive. ACT OF VALOR dropped back off the early pace, raced four to five wide into the upper stretch, angled near the rail and never threatened. KING ECLIPTICAL stalked the pace, raced five wide near the three sixteenths pole and weakened in the drive. PER RULING FROM HIWU, LUCKYTOBEINAMERICAN WAS DISQUALIFIED FOR POSITIVE TEST.

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Luckytobeinamerica
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, shuffled break, rail bid, moved up

ENTRY.NAME: King Ecliptical
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Martin Kaci

ENTRY.NAME: Brit's Candyman
ENTRY.OWNER: Kenwood Racing LLC and Paterpop Racing

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Act of Valor
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 4-5w upper stretch, angled rail, no bid

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Purse 28000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 2 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 26 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FOXY JUNIOR showed good early foot along the inside and held gamely to be clear under strong handling. ISTHATYOURHARLEY stalked the top pair down the backstretch, made a four wide bid near the quarter pole and finished gamely to the wire. EARLY FROST was forwardly place to lay up close early on and weakened through the upper stretch racing between rivals two to three wide. MIKEY'S JEWEL was off slowly and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Early Frost
ENTRY.OWNER: IBB Thoroughbred and Stem Brandon Paul

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 13600. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 26. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COLONEL MOORHEAD off slowly, gradually moved up early from the outside three deep to prompt the early pace, dug in late and prevailed under all out pressure. SHANGHAI CANDY settled off the early going to race in hand early, moved up five wide into the upper stretch and finishe gamely to the wire. LAKE NAKURU was off a step slow, made a three wide bid near the quarter pole between rivals and was outkicked late. FEDERAL CASE race mid pack early, raced four to five wide in the drive and kept on willingly late. HIBACHI showed good early foot between rivals and faded. WAHOOWA WAHOOWA prompt the pace from the inside under steady urging and faded in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Lake Nakuru
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, off step slow, 3wd bid 1/4, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Federal Case
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4-5 wide bid, kept on willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Colonel Moorhead
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, pace 3p outside, all out

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 26. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DANCE A LITTLE JIG settled off the early pace to race in hand , moved up four wide near the quarter pole to challenge and just got up from the outside of Wicked t in his final strides. WICKED T rated along to tracked the early sprinter, moved up three wide through the far turn to challenge, dug in late and just missed in a game effort. LONDONDERRY dropped back off the early pace, raced from the outside in the stretch and finished willingly to the wire. RIDGELYSREDHOT tracked the early leader from the inside and faded. GIMME'S GOLDENGIRL raced mid pack early on, was six deep into the upper stretch and lacked a rally. PAYNT BY NUMBER sprinted clear to a long early lead down the backstretch and was empty the final quarter of a mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Londonderry
ENTRY.OWNER: Cirexis Stable and Rodriguez Miguel A

ENTRY.NAME: Gimme's Goldengirl
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 6wd upper stretch, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked T
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 3p, bid far turn, dug in, missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 53. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SCOREBOARD LILY vied three deep, kicked clear through the far turn and kept a safe distance under a steady hand ride. BUSTIN WIDE OPEN vied for the early lead along the inside and narrowly held the place postion. UNCAPTURED GRACE stalked the early pace, raced along the inside into the upper stretch and kept on to the wire. SIMPLE JUSTICE chased the pace from the outside of foes under steady pressure, raced five to six wide into the upper stretch and had no late rally. CHARLYS WILD ANGEL dropped back early on, raced three to four wide in the lane and never threatened.

ENTRY.NAME: Charlys Wild Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, 3-4 wide lane, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Uncaptured Grace
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, inside upper stretch, kept on
